TopicTitle: how long of you been playing ksp?

Articles.Content: I've been playing since mid-2016 how about you?

I think I first played the game at or around .10. I had stuck with the trial version after they released more versions until 2012! so I think that makes my first version .16! The best $18.00 I ever spent.
I opened the game for the first time somewhere in 2011 (0.9), then I had long pause when I couldn't play because of potato pc, returned in what I believe was 2014 and I'm playing since then.
I jumped on the train at 1.0, around mid-2015. So I'm a latecomer, relatively speaking.

June 4th, 2017.  Version 1.3.

Had a FB post about being accepted into The Kerbal Space Program.  One person thought it was a real thing, and I was leaving the planet.

I bought the game at Christmas, so less than 2 months. Steam says I've racked up 249 hours already. 

I can stop any time I like...

March 2013 for me, v18.3.

Not playing as intensely nowadays, but still hooked.

December 30th, 2012.

The world did not end that year.  That is the year the world began.
I began playing when version 1.0.0 came out. 2015.
It was around 0.15 if I remember right 2011 or 2012.  You had to get a mod to dock so it was a few before 0.18.  I remember I was very happy when they made docking stock.
June 2013. Don't remember the version. .20?
More than a year less than 2 years. Not really sure though.
No idea. It may have been .16. I know that I bought the game, played it a little, and then stopped after some time. I got back to it and it was .19.

Judging by my screenshots collection, sometime shortly before July 25th 2014.

My first pic is of a satellite in Mun orbit, so I'd guess July 22/23rd.
I started playing on xbox about a year ago and recently got it on PC.
I received the game as a gift for Christmas 2013. The then-current version was .23
Holy mother of all donkeys, 6 years already?

I can't believe that it was May 2016 when I bought the game. KSP has sent the quality of my life skyrocketing.

Happy Explosions!
Since July 2014, v23.5.
March 2012, not sure what version it was at, exactly. It was shortly before Minmus was added.

Since Christmas 2014.

I was stuck at home due to a blizzard and decided to give myself a Christmas gift.

Best $17.99 I ever spent.

Over 3,200 hours later, I'm still having a blast and still learning.

MM

v0.15 

Sometime in the spring of '12.
